data.title: Mathematical Ancestors
data.meta_description: The Mathematical Ancestors  page for the User Sites Site on the USNA Website. This page was last updated on Wed Jul 10 10:54:28 EDT 2024.
data.text:
The Mathematics Genealogy Project has enabled just about any mathematician with a Ph. D. to trace his or her "ancestry" (chain of thesis advisors) into the eighteenth century and beyond. Things get complicated as one goes back, since the advisor/student relation was not always strictly defined and many mathematicians had multiple advisors. In my own case, I can claim illustrious ancestors through two "German" lineages (which split at William Story, who had two advisors, but reunite at the eighteenth century mathematician Abraham Kästner). But my favorite lineage splits from the second one at Felix Klein, and includes Leibniz, Lagrange and my mathematical hero Leonhard Euler!

First Lineage

Abraham Kästner begat Johann Mayer (Göttingen, 1773)

Johann Mayer begat Enno Dirksen (Göttingen, 1820,Historiae progresuum instrumentorum mensurae angulorum...)

Enno Dirksen begatKarl Jacobi (Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, 1825,Disquisitiones analyticae de fractionibus simplicibus)

Karl Jacobi begat Friedrich Richelot (Königsberg, 1831,De resolutione algebraica aequationes X257=1, sive de divisione circuli per bisectionem anguli septies repetitam in partes 257 inter se aequales commentario coronata)

Friedrich Richelot begat Carl Neumann (Köningsberg, 1856,De problemate quodam mechanico, quod ad primam classem integralium ultraellipticorum revocatur)

Carl Neumann begat William E. Story (Leipzig, 1875,On the Algebraic Relations Existing Between the Polars of a Binary Quantic)

William E. Story begatSolomon Lefschetz (Clark, 1911,On the Existence of Loci with Given Singularities)

Solomon Lefschetz begatNorman E. Steenrod (Princeton, 1936,Universal Homology Groups)

Norman E. Steenrod begat Franklin P. Peterson (Princeton, 1955,Generalized Cohomotopy Groups)

Franklin P. Peterson begat Michael E. Hoffman (M.I.T., 1981,Cohomology Endomorphisms of Complex Flag Manifolds)

Second Lineage

Abraham Kästner begat Johann Pfaff (Göttingen, 1786,Commentario de ortibus et occasibus siderum apud auctores classicos commemoratis)

Johann Pfaff begat Carl Friedrich Gauss (Helmstedt, 1799,Demonstratio nova theorematis omnem functionem algebraicam rationalem integram unius variabilis in factores reales primi vel secundi gradus resolvi posse)

Carl Friedrich Gauss begat Christian Gerling (Göttingen, 1812,Methodi proiectionis orthographicae usum ad caculos parallacticos facilitandos explicavit simulque eclipsin solarem die)

Christian Gerling begat Julius Plücker (Marburg, 1823,Generalum analyeseos applicationem ad ea quae geometriae altioris et mechanicae basis et fundamenta sunt e serie Tayloria deducit)

Julius Plücker begat Felix Klein (Bonn, 1868,Über die Transformation de allgemeinen Gleichung des zweiten Grades zwischen Linien-Koordinaten auf eine kanonische Form)

Felix Klein begat William E. Story (Leipzig, 1875,On the Algebraic Relations Existing Between the Polars of a Binary Quantic)

William E. Story begatSolomon Lefschetz (Clark, 1911,On the Existence of Loci with Given Singularities)

Solomon Lefschetz begatNorman E. Steenrod (Princeton, 1936,Universal Homology Groups)

Norman E. Steenrod begat Franklin P. Peterson (Princeton, 1955,Generalized Cohomotopy Groups)

Franklin P. Peterson begat Michael E. Hoffman (M.I.T., 1981,Cohomology Endomorphisms of Complex Flag Manifolds)

Third Lineage

Erhard Weigel begat Gottfried Leibniz (Altdorf, 1666,Disputatio inauguralis de casibus perplexis in jure)

Gottfried Leibniz begat Nicolas Malebranche

Nicolas Malebranche begat Jacob Bernoulli (Basel, 1684,Solutionem tergemini problematis arithmetici, geometrici et astronomici)

Jacob Bernoulli begat Johann Bernoulli (Basel, 1690,Dissertatio de effervescentia et fermentatione)

Johann Bernoulli begat Leonhard Euler (Basel, 1726,Dissertatio physica de sono)

Leonhard Euler begat Joseph Louis Lagrange (no degree)

Joseph Louis Lagrange begat Simeon Poisson (École Polytechnique, 1800)

Simeon Poisson begat Gustav Dirichlet (Bonn, 1827)

Gustav Dirichlet begat Rudolf Lipschitz (Universität Berlin, 1853,Determinatio status magnetici viribus inducentibus commoti in ellipsoide)

Rudolf Lipschitz begat Felix Klein (Bonn, 1868,Über die Transformation de allgemeinen Gleichung des zweiten Grades zwischen Linien-Koordinaten auf eine kanonische Form)

Felix Klein begat William E. Story (Leipzig, 1875,On the Algebraic Relations Existing Between the Polars of a Binary Quantic)

William E. Story begatSolomon Lefschetz (Clark, 1911,On the Existence of Loci with Given Singularities)

Solomon Lefschetz begatNorman E. Steenrod (Princeton, 1936,Universal Homology Groups)

Norman E. Steenrod begat Franklin P. Peterson (Princeton, 1955,Generalized Cohomotopy Groups)

Franklin P. Peterson begat Michael E. Hoffman (M.I.T., 1981,Cohomology Endomorphisms of Complex Flag Manifolds)
